name: ROBERT GAMA
aboutParagraphs: I'm Robert, a second-year Economics student at Claremont McKenna College and a Robert Day and Henry R. Kravis Scholar. I grew up in Pomona as a first-generation Mexican-American, and that background shapes how I think about opportunity and access in business.

I'm interested in consulting because it combines strategic thinking, teamwork, and solving real problems. I co-founded Cariño Botánica, a zero-waste refill store serving the Inland Empire, and I currently advise climate tech startups through Claremont Sustainability Consulting.

Outside of academics and business, I'm involved in Scholars of Finance, co-founded CMC's Breakfast Club, and perform with Mariachi Serrano. In my free time, I read, garden, and stay active through rock climbing, running, and yoga.

projects.title: ARTWORK
projects.subtitle: Art, Pottery & Paintings
blurb: I started painting as a way to slow down and pay attention.
Over time it became a practice I shared with friends and family, and I began giving pieces away.
This page is a small archive of work I’ve made across different mediums.

projects.title: CARIÑO BOTÁNICA
projects.subtitle: Zero-waste refillery
blurb: Cariño Botánica is a zero-waste refillery built to make everyday essentials more accessible.
I led day-to-day operations, vendor sourcing, and community outreach while learning what it takes to run a mission-driven business.
The work shaped how I think about systems, pricing, and what actually fits into people’s lives.
